attributes.action: Include an option to state disagreement with a petition on the petition website.
attributes.background:
Petitions of opposing viewpoints already exist on this website and some positions may gather support but still be opposed by a greater number of people. 
By including an option to "disagree with this petition" the petitions process can be simplified and made more representative of public opinion.

attributes.action: Introduce a standardised 'no added sugar' label
attributes.background: Being in the situation of needing to make lifestyle changes and cutting down on sugar, it turned out to be a lot more difficult to find food and drinks without added sugar than expected. Most processed food contains added sugar, not just the obvious sweets, cake and fizzy drinks!
attributes.additional_details: The red, amber and green food labelling has made it easier to identify healthier food and drinks but added sugar can still only be identified by going through the list of ingredients. In a time of increasing numbers of diabetes, obesity, cancer and other conditions a healthy lifestyle should be made easy. Natural sugar is still sugar but the way healthier option as it comes combined with nutrients.

attributes.action: Require Schools in England to teach & sing the National Anthem once a week
attributes.background: Only 35% of the UK are proud to be British says a recent poll, this is a giant drop from 10 years ago! Why? The UK with England at it's heart invented the most popular sports. Have legends in Music, Arts, Science, Finance.. Team GB came 2nd at the Olympics!! So let's help regrow the National pride!!
attributes.additional_details: The USA, France and many countries sing their Anthem weekly in schools. Why do we not? We have so much to be proud of. From Yorkshire Puddings to Julie Dench, Mo Farah to Harry Potter. Whether it's Music, Arts, Sports, Commerce or any other possible area England are up there and dominating. Patriotism is falling rapidly, we need to help regrow the passion and allow our children to be taught the Anthem in Schools and to be proud like they should be of the great Country which they are living in.

attributes.action: Urgent review of Business Rates for Small Businesses
attributes.background: Business Rates in this country are driving existing Businesses into debt and liquidation, preventing them from expanding and new Businesses from forming. The extortionate cost of Business Rates are set far too high and there is very little help available and no incentive for Local Councils to help
attributes.additional_details: To run a Business, premises are often required. Different types of Businesses have different requirements. For example, a Small Office Business may run with low Business Rates and a high turn-over. Where as a Small Manufacturer may require a much larger premises, huge Business Rates, and have a smaller profit margin. We need a fairer and balanced Business Rates system that works for the different types of Businesses, because at the moment it is killing our Small Businesses and preventing growth

attributes.action: Examine viable options for nationalising Thames Water.
attributes.background: In March 2018 up to 20,000 London households suffered an unplanned interruption in their water supply.  This lasted several days and caused significant hardship and distress. It was likely due to vital infrastructure being unable to cope with adverse weather conditions due to underinvestment.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2018/jan/09/nationalise-rail-gas-water-privately-owned

https://www.theguardian.com/business/nils-pratley-on-finance/2017/nov/24/thames-water-explains-why-nationalisation-is-suddenly-popular

https://www.telegraph.co.uk/business/2017/07/01/thames-water-bows-ofwat-pressure-chairman-heads-exit/

https://www.ofwat.gov.uk/ofwat-statement-thames-water-leakage-commitments/

https://www.theguardian.com/business/2017/nov/30/thames-water-ofwat-performance

attributes.action: lower to a 5% VAT  rather than 20% vet bills and costs to every pet owner
attributes.background: realising i pay more on VAT pet bills than my yearly gas and electric Bill, it's stupid yes pets are an option so I understand the cost but to most elderly a dog/pet is what they get up for every morning it's not fair for them to be paying this amount or anyone for that matter

attributes.action: Help long term borough council foster carers move home to Care for more children
attributes.background:
I am a foster carer with over 12 years experience, having looked after over 45 children. 
I believe the government could help long serving foster carers to move to a larger home so that more children have access to good levels of care.
attributes.additional_details: The average IFA placement is over 2.5 times the cost of an in house placement for a looked after child. Meaning that if I had enough room for another LAC at home I would save the government over £500000 in the next ten years. Surely some level of investment coupled with a contract for the foster carers would be a very sound investment in the long term. I am sure that every councils IFA bill far exceeds its bill for in house carers. Let's fix this problem.

attributes.action: Set minimum prices for milk and other dairy products
attributes.background: Supermarkets force dairy farms to sell milk at below production costs or lose contracts. So dairy farms prioritise milk yield of cattle over animal welfare leading to cruelty(e.g zero grazing, unhealthy cattle selectively bred for milk yield only). Huge amounts of unsold milk is poured down drains.
attributes.additional_details:
Milk is still cheaper than bottled water, even after recent price rises due to some dairies being driven out of business by having to sell to supermarkets at a loss, reducing supply. That's crazy.
https://food.ndtv.com/opinions/dairy-farmers-call-for-supermarket-boycott-as-milk-price-falls-1204828
https://www.theguardian.com/business/2015/aug/06/dairy-farmers-call-for-supermarkets-boycott-as-milk-price-falls
https://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/price-of-milk-to-go-up-after-dairy-closures-tr220h3sr

attributes.action: Make it illegal for schools/colleges to start lessons before 10AM
attributes.background: Child sleep disorders in the uk are on the rise. More and more children are developing mental health issues and their attitude, attendance and grades are getting worse. All because of one thing. School starting early. Most schools in the uk start their lessons around 8:30 and this is way too early.

attributes.action: Revoke Independent Schools' Charitable Status
attributes.background: Over the next 5 years the public will Subsidize £522 million in tax breaks to private schools in which 7% of the wealthy few attend. This is thanks to their status as charities. We call on the government to remove charitable status,  and thus taxpayer support,  from fee-paying schools

attributes.action: Allow all UK citizens to have a free NHS flu jab from September 2018 onwards
attributes.background: Many people considered 'at risk' are fortunate enough to be vaccinated for free, however not everybody is. The recent outbreak has caused lots of people to suffer and even more strain on the NHS. It is counterproductive to deny the flu jab to 'healthy' people as we are not invincible and do get flu.
attributes.additional_details:
It is possible to pay to have the jab at a pharmacy, but they are not all equal. Some are better than others.

'For otherwise healthy people, flu can be very unpleasant.' - NHS Choices. They acknowledge this is the case for those deemed not to be at risk, yet still do not offer us protection. 

'The surge sparked fresh pleas from doctors for the millions of people who have not had the winter flu jab, including those at particular risk from the virus, to get immunised urgently.' - The Guardian

attributes.action: Remove Parabens,Artificial Colour,Flavour & Preservatives from Infant Medication
attributes.background: Make all pharmaceutical companies removed parabens, all artificial colours, flavours and preservatives currently found in liquid medications, primarily used by parents for young children and especially babies. Babies should definitely not be exposed to parabens in this way.
attributes.additional_details:
Parabens have been proven to adversely affect the reproductive systems in rats and have no place in childrens medications

There is evidence that parabens and para- hydroxybenzoic acid may act as oestrogenic endocrine disruptors. Source below:
http://www.breastcanceruk.org.uk/science-and-research/parabens/
http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/ruth-romano/parabens-and-breast-cance_b_15963020.html
They should not be contained in product given to babies i.e. immature reproductive system/pre puberty

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for supermarket chains to display air miles on fruit.
attributes.background: Fresh fruit often travels to the UK by air, which creates huge amounts of CO2. People need the information on packaging to make choices and reduce their CO2 footprint.
attributes.additional_details:
Many people do not realise the CO2  of their food, especially when it travels by air. Aeroplanes are huge contributors to climate change.
Providing the air travel information on fruit packaging would give people the tools to reduce their CO2 footprint, and help us stop climate change.

attributes.action: More funding for the treatment of schizophrenia and chronic mental illnesses.
attributes.background: It is estimated that 1 in 6 people in the uk have a mental illness of some kind during their lifetime. At any one time about 220,000 people are being treated directly for schizophrenia in the UK by the NHS. Sufferers have the highest rates of suicide partly due to the Ill side effects of neuroleptic
attributes.additional_details:
More funding is needed to find a possible alternative to antipsychotics like cbd oil which has the potential to cure the disease short term without the side effects associated with neuroleptics.

https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/ministryofhemp.com/blog/cbd-for-schizophrenia/amp/

https://www.livingwithschizophreniauk.org/facts-and-figures/

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-17940070

attributes.action: Make Public Company Directors Personally Liable for Company Failures
attributes.background: In the UK we have created a corporate environment where Company Directors are rewarded for success and failure. This is different for SME owners where risk taking is offset by the potential of losing everything, including their home. We believe such rules should apply to Corporate Directors.
attributes.additional_details:
We believe that there needs to be greater accountability by Public Company Directors. We believe there needs to be a change to corporate law where, to be a Company Director of a PLC (or any company on a public share exchange), individuals have to provide personal securities commensurate with the financial rewards. These securities should extend to pension provisions.
By introducing a personal element of risk to Senior Executives, irresponsible risk taking will be eliminated in our major PLCs.

attributes.action: Electrocardiogram (ECG) scans should be made compulsory for all young people.
attributes.background: Test every teenager for deadly undiagnosed heart defects that kills 12 people every week in the UK. 80% of heart defects are found through ECG scans, as there are no symptoms - meaning hundreds of lives would be saved each year. One in 500 people suffer and their hearts could stop at any point.
attributes.additional_details: Renowned cardiologist Professor Sanjay Sharma, medical director for the virgin London Marathon and Professor of Cardiology at St George's University Hospital, agrees saying: 'Each week 12 young people in the UK die suddenly from a heart condition they didn't know they had.' 'The vast majority of those - more than 80% - won't have symptoms, but the same proportion would have been picked up through a three minute ECG.'

attributes.action: Include tax exempt income in child maintenance payments.
attributes.background: Child maintenance payments do not include tax-exempt income. For example, a parent who was injured in war can receive thousands of pounds per month in tax-exempt pension. Of this they would only have to pay a few pounds per week to their child.
attributes.additional_details: How is it ok that the government remove financial responsibility for children when it can clearly be afforded?

attributes.action: Make it illegal for cycle races/time trials to race on open, public ways/roads.
attributes.background:
Cycle racing/time trials on open/public roads need to be reviewed. Cycles are getting faster, meaning more danger to other road users, pedestrians etc and roads are getting busier with more cars than ever.

Cycle races/time trials should now only be held on closed ways/roads.
attributes.additional_details:
"A person who promotes or takes part in a race or trial of speed between motor vehicles on a public way is guilty of an offence."

This should include cyclists. Cycles are faster and more streamlined than they have ever been for general road use, so races/time trials on public ways are faster than they have ever been and therefore more dangerous an should be illegal. A cycle can go faster than a 50cc moped but it is illegal to race a moped, but not a cycle.

This needs seriously reviewing.

attributes.action: Increase organ donation by asking GP's to discuss the issue with their patients.
attributes.background:
I would like to raise awareness for organ donation to help those currently awaiting a transplant. At present, GP's do not ask patients whether they have ever considered donating their organs. 
I would like GP's to ask patients about organ donation as part of their routine medical appointments.
attributes.additional_details:
Over 7000 people are currently on the organ donation register awaiting a chance to improve their health and well-being. I am trying to increase awareness of the importance of organ donation across the UK and break down the stigma of having this crucial conversation. 
GP's play a vital role within our communities and have a close professional relationship with their patients, where discussions may be held freely. Please support my campaign to increase awareness and enrolment for organ donation.

attributes.action: The government should give every citizen,young and old,a fresh fruit/veg voucher
attributes.background: The government should give every citizen, young and old, a fresh fruit/veg voucher EACH WEEK to the sum of £25 and this amount should be raised by taxing unhealthy food.
attributes.additional_details: The government should be doing more to encourage people to eat more fresh fruit/veg. This can be easily achieved if all the population, young and old, are given an amount each week so spend solely on this produce. The money required could be raised by the government by raising tax on unhealthy food.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for care services to be run as for profit companies
attributes.background: The way we treat our elder reflects the way that we as a society, are evolving. I have grown to experience the care sector in England in such a way that it is my firm belief that care services should only be run as community services funded by the people for the people.
attributes.additional_details:
I'm a care worker who has worked in different services and supported people with many conditions, lifestyle and backgrounds; who has observed the national health and care crisis and increase in mental health in the the general population, leading to breakdown support networks for many people.
Being a firm believer that all people on Earth are responsible for each other, I urge Parliament to change the law and make it illegal to make a profit out of the lives of vulnerable individuals.

attributes.action: Give English constituencies a referendum on creating an English Parliament
attributes.background: Voters in English constituencies want the creation of a secular single chamber English Parliament elected separately from Westminster and located outside of London. This will address the democratic deficit experienced by English voters and give us English votes for English laws.

attributes.action: Don't Raise Income Tax to pay for NHS - Find Alternative Source of Funds
attributes.background: Research has suggested that income tax may have to rise, by as much as £2,000 per household, to meet the future needs of the NHS. This would be unacceptable when the public is struggling to even scrape by.

attributes.action: More help available for people who are suffering with mental health issues
attributes.background:
For many of us with mental health we have been failed by the services on offer within the NHS, We are often the ones left to one side. 

Offer more help to people who are admitted to A&E 

make more beds available in hospitals for people with mental health instead of sending us home to suffer.
attributes.additional_details:
We need early intervention available instead of being left until it’s simply to late. 

We need more beds available as many of us who attend A&E are often told that no beds are available or are not even offered one. 

Data compiled for the BBC by NHS Digital showed that between 2011-12 and 2015-16 the number of patients attending A&E units with psychiatric problems rose by nearly 50% to 165,000.

For the under 18s alone the numbers almost doubled to nearly 22,000.

attributes.action: Demand a pay cut of £13,612 of all MLAs in Northern Ireland
attributes.background: There has been deadlock in Stormont with key players obstructing negotiations since the assembly collapse. Public services are suffering due to the collapse while public servants receive full pay. This is unreasonable!
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.bbc.co.uk/news/amp/uk-northern-ireland-42418944
I z http://www.itv.com/news/utv/2018-03-13/bradley-rejects-claims-of-dithering-over-mla-pay/

attributes.action: Make it illegal to have alcohol at school events in which children are present.
attributes.background: Alcohol plays far too big a part in society as it is. Alcohol is a grown up thing that children should not be part of. By having alcohol at children's school events we are not only weakening the safeguarding of the children attending, but also showing them that we drink to have a good time.
attributes.additional_details:
Adults should be leading by good example. You can't teach responsible drinking while drinking in front of them. It should be respected that there are parents that want to raise their children in alcohol free environments. 
1 in 5 children are affected by a parents drinking this also needs to be taken into consideration, for some of those children school is a safe and fun environment. 
There is no argument for alcohol at schools, other than "we want it" However there are many disadvantages to it.

attributes.action: Remove all benefit caps on Kinship/sgo carers
attributes.background: Across the country kinship carer are struggling because of benefit caps leaving most of them worse off than they would be if they never took on these children. It would cost more to keep them in care make payments to these wonderful people more inline  with foster carers or please  remove the caps.

attributes.action: Fund free travel on public transport for all students in England.
attributes.background: Students do not earn money and yet have to pay for travel. This is not fair and many cannot afford it. Students are normally travelling to school/ college and shouldn't have to pay for this. This is why we feel that all students should have free travel and we urge you to sign it.

attributes.action: Make a law on age for babysitting and being left home alone
attributes.background: As confusing as it is some people think it's wrong to let teenagers under 16 look after their siblings or other young children, whilst others see no harm As it can be good to trust these days and at other times there are risks..
attributes.additional_details:
Do we educate our children how to deal with emergencies when they arise or how to cook their own food without setting fire to the kitchen.
Just think a law should be in place to protect not only the children but others around and make it a legal age to babysit

attributes.action: Raise Awarness for Morgellons Disease and co infections eg: Lymes Disease
attributes.background: I was bitten by a tick in the uk in 2011 I didn’t seek treatment as I didn’t no the risks. I was very ill over a number of years losing my hair etc. It was only when fibres started to come from my skin that I was diagnosed with Morgellons Disease a chronic form of Lymes Disease caused by the tick
attributes.additional_details: I am now under treatment but can’t be cured. Yet this Disease is still not recognised as a genuine illness as over the years patients have been dismissed as being dillusional. I am under a Dermatologist at the Royal London Hospital. Who states this is not a dillusion! The Disease needs listing on the rare disease register

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for food products to have carbon print and water usage labels
attributes.background:
The current rate of climate change is having devastating effects on the planet with natural disasters becoming more commonplace.
Some food products are much more carbon and water intensive in production than others and having these labels will allow us to be more informed.
attributes.additional_details:
With around 10% of the UK’s carbon emissions in 2016 coming from domestic agriculture https://assets.publishing.service.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/679334/2016_Final_Emissions_Statistics_one_page_summary.pdf
we should consider ways in which to reduce this.

Companies like Tesco once opted to add carbon labels to some food products on a voluntary basis; however, they then dropped this policy in part due to other retailers failing to follow suit.

attributes.action: Refund the application fee for all unsuccessful British Citizenship applications
attributes.background: As a single mother, I used my life savings to apply for British application of myself and my daughter. I denied myself of basic necessities. The Home Office refused our application and took the whole money. I can’t stop thinking about it, this has led to depression and insomnia.
attributes.additional_details: A small admin fee would be reasonable for them to keep, but not the whole fee.

attributes.action: Minimum 5 year sentence for possession of Offensive Weapons in a public place.
attributes.background: The current sentencing tariffs are insufficient and ineffective as a deterrent. On first offence, a minimum sentence of 6 months custody which may be suspended for 5 years, depending on specific circumstance. On second offence, a minimum sentence of 5 years custody, with no option of early release.
attributes.additional_details:
Current CPS sentencing guidance for 16-17 year olds, is set to 4 months minimum detention and a training order, in the worst scenarios: ( https://www.cps.gov.uk/legal-guidance/offensive-weapons-knives-bladed-and-pointed-articles ) Clearly, this is not a deterrent.
The proposed tariffs would apply to all ages. To ensure the new tariffs are clear, a campaign to publicise them to the target audience (10 years old and above suggested) should be conducted through National & local media.

attributes.action: Increase the minimum wage for apprentices to at least £6
attributes.background: Currently the minimum wage for apprentices is £3.70. This means that if an apprentice works 40 hours per week, they will only receive £7,696 a year. This is not enough money to live off and does not provide a big enough incentive for school levers to start work and have a successful career.

attributes.action: Require 5-year warranty on electrical goods to reduce environmental impact
attributes.background: White goods, TVs and other electrical items often break shortly after their warranty has expired and are often not economically viable to repair. Manufacturers should have to take greater care to ensure these items are better quality and fit for use for many years to reduce the environmental impact.

attributes.action: Urge Thameslink not to makes changes to timetable
attributes.background: Thameslink are planning in May to change the timetables which will mean that commuters will be delayed with for work etc

attributes.action: Change the A1 license - Motorcycle
attributes.background: My suggested change is if you are 18+ Years old and obtain an A1 license you can ride a motorcycle up to a 300cc with no power greater than 23 kw (30 bhp) Restrictions can be placed on the bike. This will give people an incentive to obtain this license. Making more people do motorcycle training.
attributes.additional_details:
Currently you can obtain an A1 license at 17+ Years old Which allows you to ride a motorcycle up to a 125cc with no more power of 11kw (15 bhp) you no longer display L plates, you can carry a pillion and have access to the motorway. 

Cbt allows you to ride a motorcycle up to a 125cc with no more power of 11kw (15 bhp) as long as you display L plates front and back, don’t Carry pillions and don’t go onto the motorway.

17 year olds have no restriction on what car they can drive after passing.

attributes.action: Raise the Penalty for Uninsured Motorists
attributes.background: Currently the penalty for driving a motor vehicle with no insurance is £300 and 6 points on your license. With this being the case, millions of motorists take the gamble!
attributes.additional_details:
If you are involved in a road traffic accident that was not a fault of your own, usually the third party’s insurance would cover the damage to your vehicle and your insurance excess. If however, the third party is an uninsured driver, this then falls on you to recover your costs. 

Millions of motorists are uninsured because the penalty for doing so is not severe enough. A £300 fine is cheaper than most annual insurance quotes!

The fine should be more severe to prevent this from happening.

attributes.action: Mandatory weekly hour classes in current politics in secondary schools.
attributes.background: Give secondary school children a chance to learn about the different parties in the UK and their policies (etc) from an unbiased perspective. Learn about current affairs both locally and abroad, voting etc. Give everyone the right to unbiased knowledge to make well informed decisions as adults.
attributes.additional_details: I propose hour classes once a week in order to keep children engaged and updated. Teach the requirements for voting, the process of voting, current party policies for each party, practice voting etc. Engage in current debates and learn of foreign affairs that affect both the UK and the world. Allow them the advantage of awareness when coming to the voting age for both fair and thoroughly considered decisions. Studying Holocaust Literature in my degree has inspired me to propose this.

attributes.action: Amend Highways act 1980 to allow electric powered motorcycles to use motorways
attributes.background: Recent developments have created high powered electric motorcycles, but as they do not have an engine with a capacity exceeding 50cc they are excluded from motorway travel. I propose that the Highways Act be amended to change the wording defining a motorcycle by power output not by engine capacity.
attributes.additional_details:
Highways act 1980 schedule 4 Classes of Traffic for Purposes of Special Roads
The Motorways traffic (England and wales) Regulations 1982

attributes.action: Increase armed forces budget
attributes.background: We believe that the armed forces are receiving too little in budget and pay. and we believe that they should get more money due to the fact that everyday their life is put on the line.

attributes.action: Raise awareness of endometriosis, for all women 18 to 60 +
attributes.background: Raise awareness of endometriosis, for all women 18 to 60 +,men if they know women who are effected. for delivery within professional and public services such as doctors, women's health clinics, to raise awareness of issues faced, treatment by doctors and early detection.
attributes.additional_details: is is important to gain a better understanding of the long term costs and implications to health of those who are effected, awareness of the amount of women affected, hereditary implications and risks associated such as forced hysterectomies, major surgeries and the long term implications to finances and employment of those concerned due to pain and discomfort of symptoms.

attributes.action: Public enquiry into child sexual abuse and exportation in Cleveland
attributes.background: Cleveland police have investigated child sexual abuse and exploitation with little result. I believe many more people should have been charged and many people were too scared to come forward. The impact of this has devastated many people and even led to drug and alcohol problems.

attributes.action: Ban the sale and farming of non-free range eggs.
attributes.background: I want to start this petition as I feel it is wrong to farm eggs in factories then sell them as the eggs are not healthy but also the chicken who creates the eggs is tortured and pumped with chemicals and I feel this is wrong.

attributes.action: Make snow days a compulsory paid day off
attributes.background: We are asking the government to make snow days a compulsory paid day off we ask that under a amber warning for snow that if you cannot get into work or the company that you work for does not trade that we are paid for it

attributes.action: Bring Home The QE2
attributes.background:
The QE2 was the last of the great liners build on Clydeside. 
In 2008 it was sold to a company in Dubai, since then it has been sitting in a dock rotting with no work been carried out on it.
I think the British Government should purchase the ship and bring it back to the Clyde. Where it Belongs.

attributes.action: Debate the protection of vulnerable people from excessive insurance renewals
attributes.background:
The government needs to protect elderly and vulnerable people who are unable to look for and change to more competitive deals with alternative insurance providers for home insurance.

Which may result in the elderly person and property not being insured as the excessive cost is prohibitive
attributes.additional_details: I have personal experience of a number of elderly persons receiving excessive home insurance renewal premiums which were five times market rate. This is due to the insurance company's understanding that the elderly could be without internet access or otherwise isolated and would find it difficult or indeed impossible to move to cheaper alternative providers - and therefore incumbent insurance companies inflate renewals and any subsequent offers as there is no independent oversight available.

attributes.action: Stop schools being able to confiscate phones for more than the shool day.
attributes.background: Many schools confiscate phones if they are seen or heard. However the problem arises when schools confiscate a phone overnight or sometimes over multiple days. Kids should have right to bring their phones to school and also take them back at the end of the day.
attributes.additional_details: Our school has created a rule where if any phone makes a noise or is seen during the school day (including break) it will be confiscated and you will have to collect at the end of the following day. This is also the case in many other schools. Due to kids signing a 'home school agreement' which apparently gives them the right to do this. The government should assign rules that restrict schools from being allowed to take phones over night.

attributes.action: Require schools to start at 9:30 and end at 3:30.
attributes.background: Children find it extremely difficult to wake up at 7:30 and get to school by 8 or 8:30. Most children hate coming to school because of the time you have to wake up. An extra hour of sleep helps retain information and helps the child perform better at school.
attributes.additional_details: Starting school at 9:30 and ending it at 3:30 gives us 6 hours of education where students are actually awake in lessons because they have had enough time to sleep.

attributes.action: Legally enforce an opt-out solution for paper publications sent by organisations
attributes.background: Universities, schools, and professional bodies frequently post paper journals and other publications to their members. These are usually unsolicited, and often thrown away unread. In the era of online technology, they are a waste of public and private money, and needlessly damage the environment.
attributes.additional_details: It would be very simple to create a central website (one could be built at very little expense), to which these large organisations must have a log in.  Individuals could then record their wish to unsubscribe from monthly paper publications (by organisation): expressing their mailing frequency preference, or requesting online issues instead.  The government should compel these organisations to have a membership to this system, and to respect the preferences of those receiving these publications.
